timeline.author: kashike
kashike

replies.bodyText: In the code prototype he showed off on Discord, @Async is meant to be combined with @Subscribe.
replies.author: astei

replies.bodyText: Sure, but Async is a bit vague here, especially when working with certain other libraries that have classes named the same.
replies.author: kashike

replies.bodyText: I don't think @Async will be a big problem, you're more likely to confuse the guava Subscribe with the velocity one with the current libraries, I don't see another Async class or annotation
replies.author: Cybermaxke

replies.bodyText: Perhaps then Velocity's annotation should just get a new async boolean property?
replies.author: Proximyst

replies.bodyText: Personally I prefer @Async, but an async property is also an option. @astei what do you prefer?
replies.author: Cybermaxke

timeline.bodyText: I'm not a huge fan of the name AsyncTask. I don't have another good name for this - perhaps EventTask or even EventContinuation would be better (and then rename AsyncTask.WithContinuation to EventContinuation.Deferred).
timeline.author: astei

replies.bodyText: I'm also not a big fan of the current naming, but I haven't found a good name to actually represent what is does. DeferredEventTask (DeferredTask) could be another option?
replies.author: Cybermaxke

replies.bodyText: It needs to include the word Event as otherwise it could be confused with the scheduler. I think DeferredEventTask is fine.
replies.author: astei

timeline.message: Untargeted handlers should be cached weakly. Other small changes.

Implement async event tasks.

Events will now only be handled by an async executor if necessary. This should improve performance for lightweight listeners.
